page.title: 01The Evesham District.
page.content: The{main places}in our 'D Block' are Evesham, Hampton, Cropthorne and Charlton.{Evesham}is a medium sized town by the{River Avon.}There are some Abbey ruins, a bell tower, museum, library, town hall, market and railway station. Evesham is famous because of the Battle of Evesham in l265.Evesham has a lot of Market gardens and is surrounded by hills in the distance. {Hampton}is a medium sized village, it has a Church and is by the River Isbourne. The River Avon has Hampton Ferry crossing it. The 'old school' building is flats now. On Clarke's Hill there was a vineyard 9OO years ago. There are market gardens and a disused railway.{Cropthorne and Charl- {ton}are both small villages with str- eams and are on the edge of the River Avon. They have half-timber cottages and market garden land around them.
